title: Science — 10th Grade (Beginner)
description: A beginner-friendly roadmap for 10th grade science covering core concepts in Physics, Chemistry, and Biology with activities and short quizzes for each chapter.

chapters.title: Matter and Its Properties
chapters.content:
Overview

Understand states of matter, classifications, and physical vs chemical properties.

  • States of matter: solid, liquid, gas
  • Physical vs chemical properties
  • Elements, compounds, mixtures
  • Physical and chemical changes
resources: Simple home experiments: melting/freezing, dissolving salt/sugar
Short video: physical vs chemical changes

quizzes.question: What is the difference between a physical change and a chemical change?
quizzes.answer: Physical change alters form without changing composition; chemical change forms one or more new substances.

quizzes.question: Give an example of a mixture and how you would separate its components.
quizzes.answer: Salt + sand — add water to dissolve salt, filter sand, then evaporate water to recover salt.

chapters.title: Atomic Structure and Periodic Table
chapters.content:
Overview

Learn basic atomic structure and how the periodic table is organized.

  • Atom: nucleus, protons, neutrons, electrons
  • Atomic number and mass number
  • Periodic table groups and periods
  • Metals, non-metals, metalloids
resources: Model kit or paper atom models

quizzes.question: What particles are found in the nucleus of an atom?
What determines the element's atomic number?

chapters.title: Chemical Reactions and Equations
chapters.content:
Overview

Understand basic types of chemical reactions and how to write simple chemical equations.

  • Reactants and products
  • Types: combination, decomposition, displacement
  • Conservation of mass and balancing equations
resources: Guided lab: vinegar + baking soda reaction

quizzes.question: Name a type of reaction where two substances combine to form one.

chapters.title: Force and Motion (Basics)
chapters.content:
Overview

Grasp basic ideas of force, motion, speed, and inertia.

  • Speed vs velocity vs acceleration (intro)
  • Balanced and unbalanced forces
  • Newton's first law (inertia)
  • Friction basics

quizzes.question: What is inertia?
quizzes.answer: The tendency of an object to resist changes in motion.

quizzes.question: If a car moves at constant speed in a straight line, the net force is:

chapters.title: Energy and Its Forms
chapters.content:
Overview

Identify different forms of energy and basic conservation ideas.

  • Kinetic and potential energy
  • Heat, light, sound, electrical energy (overview)
  • Energy transformations

quizzes.question: Give an example of an energy transformation.
quizzes.answer: Battery chemical → electrical → light in a bulb.

quizzes.question: Which form of energy depends on motion?

chapters.title: Cell Biology and Organisms
chapters.content:
Overview

Understand basic cell structure and organization of life.

  • Cell: basic unit, organelles
  • Plant vs animal cells
  • Tissues, organs, organ systems
  • Photosynthesis (overview)

quizzes.question: Name two organelles found in plant cells but not animal cells.

chapters.title: Ecosystems and Environment
chapters.content:
Overview

Learn interactions in ecosystems and basic conservation principles.

  • Food chains/webs
  • Producers, consumers, decomposers
  • Habitats and biodiversity
  • Human impact

quizzes.question: What is a producer in a food chain?
quizzes.answer: An organism that makes its own food (e.g., plants).

quizzes.question: Give one human activity that can harm biodiversity.

chapters.title: Practical Lab Skills & Revision
chapters.content:
Overview

Consolidate lab safety, measurement, and data recording skills; quick revision of key ideas.

  • Lab safety and instruments (balance, thermometer)
  • Recording observations and basic graphs
  • Revision exercises

quizzes.question: What is the correct unit for mass?
Why is it important to repeat experiments?
quizzes.answer: To confirm results and reduce random error.
